org.magelan.core
Class DefaultEntity

java.lang.Object
  org.magelan.core.DefaultEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Entity, DrawingElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
CircleEntity, EllipseEntity, HatchEntity, ImageEntity, InsertEntity, LineEntity, PathEntity, PointEntity, PolyLineEntity, RectangleEntity, TextEntity, ViewEntity
public abstract class DefaultEntity
extends java.lang.Object
implements Entity, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

A default graphical entity implementation. Features layer, color and linestyle support. It is most convenient that entity classes extend (if possible) this class instead of implementing the Entity interface themselves.

Version:
3.0, 05/2004
Author:
Assen Antov
See Also:
Serialized Form

setID

public final void setID(int id)
Description copied from interface: Entity
Sets the unique identification number of the entity. This number will persist during the whole lifespan of the entity. The identification number will be determined and set by the DrawingModel.add(Object) method. Some editor classes may also need to modify the id of an entity and therefore the method is not package-private. Any attempts, however, to modify it from outside the org.magelan.core package will result in an exception to be thrown.

Specified by:
setID in interface Entity
Parameters:
id - unique entity identification number to set
See Also:
Entity.getID()

getID

public final int getID()
Description copied from interface: Entity
Gets the unique identification number of the entity. 0 is a reserved value and if returned by this method means that no id has been set.

Specified by:
getID in interface Entity
Returns:
unique entity identification number
See Also:
Entity.setID(int)

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                  DrawingModel d)
Description copied from interface: Entity
A graphics renderer of the entity. By convention this method will assume that the parameter graphics context is fully configured, i.e. the proper transform, clipping shape, color, stroke and alpha shall be set before calling the paint method. The task of configuring the graphics context shall typically be performed by a DrawingRenderer. Thus the painting method for most of the entitites will simply draw entity's shape to the graphics context:

g.draw(getShape());

The DrawingModel parameter will not be normally used. It is provided for more complex / composite entitites like groups, blocks and views, that will need to paint a number of shapes, possibly from different layers. Therefore such entities will need access to the layers, styles, etc. from the DrawingModel they belong to. Those entities may configure the graphics context themselves.

Specified by:
paint in interface Entity
Specified by:
paint in interface DrawingElement
Parameters:
g - graphics context to draw to
d - the drawing model to get rendering information from (layers, colors, etc.)
See Also:
DrawingElement.paint(Graphics2D, DrawingModel)

hashCode

public final int hashCode()
Description copied from interface: Entity
Computes a hash code value for the instance. The most convenient implementation of this method is to return entity's unique identification number. Note however that until the entity is added to a CoreModel and such a number is set the hashCode() method will return 0.

Specified by:
hashCode in interface Entity
Overrides:
hashCode in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a hash code value
See Also:
Entity.getID()
